content: MILANO, May 4 (Reuters) - Credit Agricole has not submitted any request to Italian regulators to raise its stake in Banco BPM above 10%, the head of the Italian arm of the French bank Giampiero Maioli said on Thursday.

Credit Agricole emerged as Banco BPM's single biggest investor a year ago, shortly after UniCredit held fire on a buyout offer it was ready to launch. The French bank has since raised its stake to 9.9%.Banco BPM, the third-largest bank in Italy, has long been seen as an attractive takeover target in the banking sector, where more consolidation is expected. (Reporting by Andrea Mandala, writing by Gianluca Semeraro, editing by Alvise Armellini)
